meanings.definition: To leave or go away quickly
meanings.sent1: The cat scrammed when it heard a loud noise.
meanings.sent2: She scrammed from the party as soon as she saw her ex-boyfriend.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel scrammed up the tree when it spotted a dog below.
meanings.sent4: The students scrammed out of the classroom when the bell rang.
meanings.sent5: The thief scrammed down the alley to escape the police.

meanings.sent1: I accidentally scrammed the puzzle pieces together.
meanings.sent2: The wind scrammed the papers all over the yard.
meanings.sent3: The chef scrammed the ingredients in a hurry, creating a new dish.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were all scrammed up after the argument.
meanings.sent5: The toddler scrammed the toys in a big pile on the floor.

meanings.sent1: He scrammed down his food before heading out to play.
meanings.sent2: The hungry dog scrammed the treats in seconds.
meanings.sent3: The kids scrammed the candy at the birthday party.
meanings.sent4: She scrammed the popcorn during the movie.
meanings.sent5: The raccoon scrammed the leftovers from the picnic.
